channel.title: Halp
channel.description:
Don't know where to post this... First problem : Anybody know of any good tutorials that deal with loading sprite sheets and they work? I would like to make use of one when the cannon "fires".
Second problem : [URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/850/64125483.png/][IMG]http://img850.imageshack.us/img850/4901/64125483.png[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/851/68394693.png/][IMG]http://img851.imageshack.us/img851/7792/68394693.png[/img][/URL]
The cannon is moves in the direction of the mouse.. I was wondering what would be the best method of have the "wheel" stay in place but only the cannon can change direction.
My thoughts are having two separate images. One for the wheel and another for the cannon and just having the cannon rotate. Only issue i see with this is that the wheel image will need to be transparent ..which really isn't an issue.
Anyways if you know a better way let me know.

item.title: Halp
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Found some nice tuts on the subject… heading out right now but maybe one of you can answer by the time I get back… how would I go about the “timing” of frame to frame animation?

Read full topic

item.title: Halp
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

Don’t used getScaledInstance, its slow as fuck.

Read full topic

item.title: Halp
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

You could load the sheet into a BufferedImage and use getSubImage, or getScaledInstance from Image

Read full topic

item.title: Halp
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Budda:

Or just move the centre of rotation to the wheel.

Haha I knew there was an easier way… just couldn’t think of it. Thanks!
Came out a little funky, but will do it.
So anybody know of any good tutorials on sprite sheets?

Read full topic

item.title: Halp
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

Or just move the centre of rotation to the wheel.

Read full topic

item.title: Halp
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

You will need two different objects for the cannon - one for the base and one for the… other part :|… Make the cannon rotate around the center of the cannon and not the center of the… shooting part (Look up rotating around pivots).

Read full topic

item.title: Halp
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Don’t know where to post this…
First problem :
Anybody know of any good tutorials that deal with loading sprite sheets and they work? I would like to make use of one when the cannon “fires”.

Second problem :

The cannon is moves in the direction of the mouse…
I was wondering what would be the best method of have the “wheel” stay in place but only the cannon can change direction.

My thoughts are having two separate images. One for the wheel and another for the cannon and just having the cannon rotate. Only issue i see with this is that the wheel image will need to be transparent …which really isn’t an issue.

Anyways if you know a better way let me know.
